Switch to turn on pointers on the map

Welcome to Peloton! An app designed to measure and map the quality of the roads for cyclists. All of this is done using only the sensors inside your smartphone. The beauty of this all is that everybody with a smartphone and a mount for his/her phone can start cycling and contributing to the map!
Want to start cycling and collecting data? Just mount your phone, make sure you have an mobile internet and go to the ‘Measure’ tab.
Just want to see the quality of the roads in your neighbourhood? Go to the ‘Map’ tab and select what you want to see in the upper right corner.
Go to the ‘Settings’ tab if you want to edit the settings.
Want to see the most active cyclists and the distance they contributed to the map? Go to the ‘Leaderboard’ tab and see all the details.
Go to the ‘Username’ to choose a username if you haven’t already or add a second one.
If you press the ‘Save bike location’ tab, the app will save your current location in the background and put a pointer on the map. This way you will never forget where you parked your bike again.

Welcome! Before you can start collecting data, make sure that your smartphone is firmly attached to your bicycle for optimal measurements. A working mobile internet connection is also required while starting and ending your measurements. We will now walk you through the steps you have to take before you can start! First make sure your bicycle is in a natural position. Now wait until your device has found a gps connection and tap the ‘Calibrate’ button.
Your phone is now calibrated and you can now press the ‘Start’ button and start cycling!

We will now measure the data of your trip until you press the ‘Stop and save’ button. This will save the data to our server and end your session. Afterwards you will be able to see your trip on the map if your data was useable.
Thanks for contributing! You can now go back to the main menu or start collecting data again!
Searching for location, wait here until location is found.
